title: Analyze Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Maintenance Therapy
text: Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia () treatment broadly divided 2 phases - Intensive Phase Maintenance Phase. intensive phase treatment divided 4 sub-phases – induction, consolidation, interim maintenance delayed intensification [@das2022protocol]. Maintenance therapy (MT), longest phase treatment consists ~2 years (96 weeks 8 cycles - 12 weeks per cycle) [@das2022protocol]. Patients advised visit hospital every alternate week (every two weeks) consultation weekly basis case toxicities (neutropenia, thrombocytopenia ). Overall, patient ideally minimum 48 visits MT. visit, patient’s blood report examined following parameters - absolute neutrophil count (ANC), platelet count (PLT) hemoglobin (HB) adjust (dose titrations) drugs: 6-mercaptopurine (6MP) Methotrexate (MTX) prescribed weekly basis.

title: Analyze Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Maintenance Therapy
text: studies, across globe, shown delivering optimal MT crucial achieve better treatment outcomes [@schmiegelow2014mercaptopurine]. Delivering optimal MT ensured prescribing maximum tolerated 6MP MTX doses adjusted patient’s hospital visit. view , package created analyse visualize MT data (ANC/PLT/HB/6MP/MTX)1. use package assist physicians evaluate MT given patient cohort center. Although, package developed considering ICiCLe--14 protocol [@das2022protocol] default, can used analyze data centers different MT protocols. case different protocol, user need alter defined parameters specific protocol function arguments. Using package user may: Convert maintenance sheets (Tata Medical Center Kolkata, India format user dependent) cleaner, single csv longitudinal data patient. Analyze MT individual patient level track patient’s MT progression therapy [@mungle2020modelling]. track patient’s cycle--cycle MT progression therapy using summary measure (SM) weighted mean (6MP*MTX) vs weighted mean ANC parameters scatterplot. cohort level SM plot analyze MT given cohort defined user. SM evaluated patient plotted together represent entire cohort [@mungle2020modelling]. Compare SM two different cohort defined user evaluate MT practice. Cohort comparisons can include clinical interventions, year-wise practice evolution, patients treated two different set physicians, user see fit [@mungle2020modelling]. Evaluate real time dosing decisions (stop, reduce increase) physicians MT based MT dosing guidelines individual patient cohort [@mungle2020modelling]. Evaluate hematological toxicities - neutropenia, thrombocytopenia anemia MT individual patient cohort. Evaluate/plot median time first 6MP dose increase individual patient cohort [@mungle2020modelling].

title: Analyze physicians' compliance to dosing guidelines: INCREASE DOSE — assess_increased_doses
text: input_files_path path file folder MT csv files (quotes). anc_threshold Absolute neutrophil count (ANC) value threshold doses increased. NOTE: Ensure threshold value represented unit input ANC data. plt_threshold Platelet (PLT) value threshold doses increased. NOTE: Ensure threshold value represented unit input PLT data. hb_threshold Hemoglobin (HB) value threshold doses increased. NOTE: Ensure threshold value represented unit input Hb data. escalation_factor Percentage increase previous tolerated dose considered "increased" dose. tolerated_dose_duration Number weeks ANC, PLT, Hb values consistently threshold dose prescription, following dose increased.

title: Analyze physicians' compliance to dosing guidelines: INCREASE DOSE — assess_increased_doses
text: Returns list (1) 'INCREASE DOSE' analysis patient listed , (2) analysis summary dataframe (3) analysis summary HTML table viewer. Pat ID Number decisions physician increased dose () Number times blood counts support dose suspension (b) Discordance (%) = (\(1 - (b/)*100)\)

title: Analyze physicians' compliance to dosing guidelines: INCREASE DOSE — assess_increased_doses
text: Atleast one threshold parameters (anc_threshold, plt_threshold, hb_threshold) must provided carry analysis. Missing threshold parameter considered. function used cohort analysis b represented median interquartile range (IQR) (25%-75%). median IQR rounded upper integer value decimal value greater equal 0.5, else lower integer value Example 1.4->1 3.75->4 User may save result list, required, analyze patient separately - use 1st element list. Please refer examples assess_anemia
